text: A quaint coffeeshop near metro Saint Henri. I went with passport barista to pick a cappuccino. It is a super tiny place with 4 stools by the window. The coffeeshop's decor gives the feeling that you are into the woods. The server was by herself and I was her only customer this morning. After I ordered a cappuccino, we chitchatted a bit about a postcard that I noticed on the shelf. It reminded my most memorable trip to Thailand. The server was very sweet; she asked me if I wanted cinnamon or chocolate over my cappuccino; it's really rare that someone asks me this. Even though I added sugar to my cappuccino; it was really bitter. Oh well, another coffeeshop off my checklist.

A quick and convenient cafe next to the metro. They also serve ready to go meals, baked goods as well as hot meals. I think they can definitely expand on the food available. There were a few high chairs to sit and eat. However this is more of a pick and go cafe. It's fairly dark and woodsy and decorated in that genre. I think the idea is great but they need to maybe cleanup/reorganize it a bit better. 

The server was very polite and helpful. I had a cappuccino with cinnamon and I loved it. There was someone else eating at that time. While the server was making my coffee, we all chit chatted. If I was ever in that area I would definitely stop by to pick up a coffee.

Le personnel est vraiment super gentil comme au bar à côté. Leur sandwich au poulet bacon peut paraître cher à prime abord mais on comprend le prix quand on y goûte. La qualité de viande est excellente et la sauce avec les piments fitte parfaitement avec le poulet. A essayer  absolument , un des meilleurs sandwich de saint-Henri en ce moment. J'ai oublié de le prendre en photo, je l'ai mangé trop vite!

Zec Café opened up about 2 months ago right next to St-Henri Metro Station, an ideal spot which previously lacked nearby options, unless of course one was to walk to the active and growing Notre-Dame Street, the heart of the neighborhood. 

A friend suggested the place to me and hinted it might be good, and so one morning, my husband and I decided to stop by to give it a shot. We were unimpressed.

The espresso they serve is Café Napoléon, a Montréal roaster. The latte I ordered was very average, a bit too strong actually, and the croissant I got alongside it was unfortunately bland. My husband had a double espresso which he found acceptable, and a veggie sandwich he told me satisfied his hunger. I took a bite from it and did not particularly enjoy it; the bread and the marinated vegetables were very ordinary, especially for a $8 sandwich. 

I know plenty of places that sell better food and coffee for cheaper or equal prices, and find myself surprised that such a coffee shop would open and successfully sustain in St-Henri. I do hope the owners will find a better formula, else I'm tempted to predict a short life for Zec Café. I hope for them that I'm wrong.

Zone d'Exploitation Contrôlée :  ZEC est le sens du nom nous explique le barista et propriétaire fort sympa des lieux.

Charmant petit café de quartier à la porte du Métro Place St-Henri.    
Je suis allé un vendredi avant-midi avec ma visite Suisse et elle a été totalement charmé par la chaleur du lieux et de son propriétaire et surtout par l'arôme et le goût perfecmento de son café TRÈS serré a-t'elle demandé!   

Pour ma part, mon Macchiato était des plus que sublime.  Mousse à point et grain des plus que surprenant.   Nous avons appris que la gamme des Napoléon torréfié pour les cafés de spécialité recevaient plus d'attention que le grain à mouture normal.  J'ai aussi été heureux de voir que le café est de torréfaction local: ville LaSalle!

Le décor est simple et amusant et suit le thème de son nom: un chack de chasse, avec peau d'ourse, panache d'orignal, bois qui craque, chaleureux endroit.

2 table de deux chaises et un mini comptoir de mur.    C'est alors plus un take-out avant d'entrée dans le métro.  Ce qui est super et enfin dans ce coin du quartier.

Ils semblent servir d'excellent croissant et croques-monsieur et ils sont la cuisine du bar d'à côté: l'Expoxy avec lequel ils ont une porte commune à l'arrière boutique.

Alors: pour notre première visite=
Service: 5/5
Ambiance et heures: 4/5    * ferme trop tôt... 15h/16h  donc pas d'espresso retour à la maison :-(
Café serré: 5/5

Ce qui nous restera à valider: croissants et bouffe, service par employés et constance du grain.

Bienvenue dans le quartier et merci d'être là sur le chemin du bureau!
De passage j'ai pris la salade poulet extra feta , tres bon. Endroit chaleureux et j'ai le gout d'y retourner pour un croissant :)
